data.description:
Motor graders are versatile machines that play a pivotal role in various projects. Participants will operate a bulldozer and complete various tasks on an active worksite as part of this engaging simulation. 

**Overview & Activities:**

Participants begin with an overview that provides context and helps identify key parts and components outside and inside the vehicle, safety tips, and the basics of a walk-around inspection performed before using any heavy machinery. Participants engage in a sort-and-match activity to reinforce essential controls and their location inside the vehicle. They are then asked to perform a single task to become familiar with operating the vehicle in a VR environment. 

**Participant Simulation:**

Before starting their simulation tasks, participants must wear personal protective equipment (PPE), conduct a walk-around inspection of the vehicle, and complete one task to familiarize themselves with the vehicle's operation. Finally, participants are challenged to complete tasks at an active worksite, including leveling a small hill, moving piles of dirt into targeted areas, and filling a trench with rocks and stones. 

**Benefits & Key Features:**
- Manipulative simulations provide hands-on practice in risk-free environments  
- Instant feedback provides â€œcorrect" or "try again" responses to guide participants  
- Flexible choice points allow participants to revisit any part of the simulation as needed 
- Realistic 3D tools, equipment, environments, and animations
